physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient experienced dizziness and palpitations after exercising. Notable history included muscle weakness, thin arm and chest muscles, and slightly reduced muscle mass. Clinical neurologic examination revealed slight weakness in neck flexion, shoulder abduction, elbow flexion and extension, abdominal muscles, and foot dorsiflexion, as well as slight scapular winging.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient had no reported progression or regression of symptoms noted in the provided information.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Electrocardiogram showed incomplete right bundle-branch block and inferior T-wave inversion. Echocardiography revealed slightly increased posterior-wall thickness (1.3 cm), normal left ventricular end-diastolic volume (170 ml), and an ejection fraction of 50% (normal range 48-72%). The cardiac catheterization showed normal coronary arteries.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: One year after the acute episode, the patient's physical capacity was categorized as New York Heart Association functional class I or II.
